definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.chinese: 半吊子進步，表面的人權。

sentences.english: This outfit should perhaps be known as the midcomeback dress.
sentences.chinese: 這件衣服或許應該被稱爲半吊子衣服。

sentences.english: "I don't believe in doing things by halves", said Mrs. Dennant.
sentences.chinese: “我不贊成做半吊子的事，”丹南特太太說。

sentences.english: On the way to be a scientist.
sentences.chinese: 所以現在是半吊子科學家。

definition: switch to a job one was not trained for
(coll.) (of one's skills, knowledge etc) limited/superficial/half-baked/sb with a smattering of knowledge (of sth)/dabbler
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
